items.title: Lenovo’s compact yet powerful Legion Tab Gen 3 Android tablet just hit a new all-time low at $399
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Labor Day sale, Lenovo is offering its 2025 Legion Tab Gen 3 for $398.99 shipped. Don’t forget to enter promo code EXTRAFIVE during checkout to see the discounted price. The tablet debuted at $500 earlier this year, with its price jumping up to $550 shortly after launch. It is, however, available with a solid $151 discount at the moment, landing $19 below its previous low and our mention from earlier this month. This is the lowest price we’ve seen for this tablet outside of special EDU and professional offers. It stands out as one of the best Android tablets you can get in this price range, and you can learn more about it below.

This compact offering from tomtoc spans roughly 12 by 6 by 3 inches, which I think strikes a nice balance between being compact while also being large enough to fit a gaming handheld like Switch 2.

The new Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, and Pixel 10 Pro XL have now been revealed and gone up for pre-order, but there’s still no new Pixel Tablet and Amazon just dropped the price significantly. You’ll now find the base model 128GB Google Pixel Tablet marked down to $249 shipped at Amazon to mark the return of this year’s Prime Day low.

items.title: Aventon cuts the price further on its Aventure 2 all-terrain e-bikes to best price of 2025 at $1,499 (Reg. $1,999)
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Final Summer/Labor Day Sale running through September 3, Aventon has dropped the price further on its Aventure 2 All-Terrain e-bike to $1,499 shipped. It started this sale having fallen from its $1,999 full price to $1,699, with an additional $200 being taken off now for the best price of the year. We’ve seen discounts mostly dropping the costs to $1,599 at best this year, with this being the first time we’ve spied it going further in the last eight months. You’re looking at a total $500 price cut while the sale continues, giving you one of the most popular legacy models from this brand at the best price of 2025 – and it even beats out 2024’s Black Friday and Christmas pricing by $200 too.

more…

items.title: The BOTSLAB 4K Security Cameras 4-Cam Kit covers your whole yard with no subscriptions
items.summary:
These days, home security is at the forefront of everyone’s mind, but there can often be so many choices for what system to go with and many can cause compromises that ultimately leave homeowners feeling regret for their decisions. Going with a basic setup can often lead to blurry and unhelpful images, while higher-priced systems tend to come with monthly subscriptions and other paywalls. That’s where BOTSLAB comes in, with its 4K Security Cameras 4-Cam Kit providing high-quality outdoor coverage alongside AI-powered features – all without the annoyance of extra fees and subscriptions.

more…

items.summary:
JOYROOM Magnetic Reusable Cable Ties (12-pack)

Buy for $8.50 (Reg. $17)

Clip the on-page 50% off coupon.

What we love

While there are all sorts of cable ties out there to choose from, these set themselves apart with a magnetic design. This allows them to latch onto the peel-and-stick portion that you can easily attach to a wide variety of surfaces. Each cable tie spans roughly 5 inches and has a variety of slots that you can use to dial in the ideal amount of tension.

This smaller single-cam option usually fetches $139 at full price, which has regularly fallen between $100 and $99 over the course of 2025, with one drop lower to $90 back at the end of March. While we have seen the price go as low as $86 in 2024, you’re otherwise looking at the third-best rate of 2025 that cuts $39 off the going rate while giving you one of the brand’s best budget-friendly dash cam options.

items.title: Finally, a cat toy that plays back – Cheerble Ball now $15 (Reg. $28)
items.summary:
Cats are curious, playful, and a little unpredictable, which makes finding the right toy a bit of a challenge. Some toys lose their charm after a few minutes. Others need apps, remotes, or endless battery swaps. The Cheerble Ball keeps things simple and fun, giving your cat a toy that actually keeps up with them. If you want a fun, automated toy for your cat, get a Cheerble Ball today for $14.97 (Reg. $27.99).

While it carries a $999 MSRP, we’ve been seeing it in 2025 keep down at $699 in full at Amazon. Since the end of July it’s been staying above $549, with past discounts this year having taken the costs as low as $379 in a series of short-term Lightning sales back at the top of the year. You’re looking at a 29% markdown off the going rate here, which saves you $200 while equipping your outdoor adventures with the means to keep your personal devices running.
